snippet: A part of the process evaluates applicants in areas like test scores, socioeconomic status and activities as well as race and ethnicity.
abstract: Admissions process at the University of Texas is notoriously opaque, based on a principal known as holistic review that takes into account test scores, socioeconomic status, activities, as well as race and ethnicity; criticisms of the policy vary, with black and Hispanic students saying it favors those from private and elite high schools, and wealthier white students contending it favors minorities.
lead_paragraph: A part of the process evaluates applicants in areas like test scores, socioeconomic status and activities as well as race and ethnicity.

headline.seo: University of Texas’ Mysterious Admissions Process
headline.main: At the University of Texas, Admissions as a Mystery
headline.print_headline: At the University of Texas, Admissions as a Mystery
